Reviews.Title: “Proper hotel, very good breakfast, the best location”
Reviews.Author: Lamossella
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our hotel choice. When choosing a hotel my focus lies on the cleanness ( I always check the bathroom and sheets before accepting a room). In this hotel rooms are small but comfortable, Everything was very proper and clean, personnel was helpful, the breakfast was nice (loved the Turkish bread). The location was also perfect for a city trip (nearby everything by foot). I would really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: kar-travel-01
Reviews.Content: Positives *Clean *Free wifi which worked great *Shampooo, soap, sewing kit, slippers, shoe shine, hairdryer, *Great location - walking distance to grand bazaar, blue mosque etc. Tram stop provides access to all other major attractions. *breakfast included and cute seats in the restaurant Cons *It smelt of fresh paint (they've painted the heaters so when they were on the smell intensified) We left the window open the following day while we were out which seemed to clear the smell. *room was a little small - double bed was against the wall *very small lobby

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: JaNar
Reviews.Content: This is a pleasant, nice and warm hotel located in historical part of Istanbul called Beyazit. I have been in Istanbul a lot, but this hotel impressed me with good price, clean and tidy rooms as well as good hospitality of hotel staff. Location: close to all major touristic attractions. 10 min to Sultanahmet or 2 stops by Tramway, which is close to hotel. Lot's of restaurants outside, great selection of turkish food. Burger King is just 2 blocks away. Breakfast: Good enough, don't expect rich variety of food. Rooms: Well decorated, very clean and tidy. Especially bathroom is clean, which is a great plus. I will definitely book Bilinc Hotel again on my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good location*clean and affordable***”
Reviews.Author: vivi868
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute choice...and turn out to be a good one. The hotel is small so the rooms are small but comfortable. The room that i got which was a queen size bed was very clean...including the bathroom which in my oponion it is very important when searching for a place to stay. Location was great...located one block away from the main street which will lead you to main attractions.. breakfast and free wifi is included so that's a plus...only thing that i did not like is that they didnt have any charger adapters for guest...but they did purchase 1 for my friends so we ended up sharing it. As how to get there....we took a cab from the airport and paid around 20$USD about 37 liras...dont go for the shuttle services inside the airport you will pay double!! just take a cab outside it was very safe...and of course we paid in USD$ to avoid any confussion. Overall is a great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with wonderful location and superb staff!”
Reviews.Author: Dana M
Reviews.Content: I am from Russia. We stayed in Bilinc Hotel in January. The hotel conquered us with it location, incredibly helpful staff and an excellent price! Staff is extremely friendly; all our requests were realized with pleasure with very high quality and fast. Arrival and departure took literally seconds. In a room was excellent wifi signal! The hotel is quiet and cozy. The room was cleaned daily, all the time we had new soaps and shampoos. Nearby tram station, a lot of great shops with good leather goods and gold, within walking distance of the Grand Bazaar, Istanbul's majority of sights in 20 minutes walking distance. The next time we go to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect !!!”
Reviews.Author: Jael_xxx
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Istanbul, the city was amazing and huge and Bilinc hotel was the best choice we ever made. Me and my sister are very thankfull to the staff because of their endless help! They were reaally kind and you can reach them every single hour. Our room was so clean and the toilets, towels etc were great too. Also the hotel is totally in the heart of Istanbul, you can easily walk to the most popular historical places... Bilinc Hotel: Dank je wel :))

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel, warm people, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie C
Reviews.Content: Hi guys! I stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend last week. As you know it is hard to find an affordable and cosy place to stay in Istanbul. When you enter, the lobby will charm you anyway :) And I can say that you'll love Turkish breakfast! The location is excellent, you can easily reach the Grand Bazaar and the Blue Mosque by walk which are both wonderful by the way there are lot to see in Istanbul. The price was reasonable for the standarts, the rooms were clean, especially linens and toilets (those are what I am looking for an hotel) and it has got cosy and warm atmosphere as well as good hospitality. For us transport service from airport to the hotel was very useful when you consider how much taxi costs and the airport-city distance. Well, we stayed for four nights and I can say that we'll definitely choose this hotel for our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “cosy hotel in a cosy cute cuty :)”
Reviews.Author: moosh31
Reviews.Content: my dad & i have stayed here 2 times, & will stay here again this weekend ;) The location is great! 20 mins walk from blue masjid ;) lively & buzzy as soon as you come out of the hotel :) Most of the the hospitality & team/management are amazing & helpful :) may allah bless them all :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: djptrvl
Reviews.Content: Bilinc Hotel located in the Beyazit area was a very good minimally priced accommodation. My husband and I have backpacked extensively and found the accommodation to be clean and comfortable. The bathrooms were spotless although a little small for anyone requiring a large bathroom. Our concern is always cleanliness and it more than met that expectation. The room was spartan and the carpet was a little worn for those to whom appearance is a necessity but again cleanliness, comfort and price are the most important things when we travel. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The desk is manned 24 hours a day and we always had our questions answered and were greeted with a smile. Included in the price was a nice and varied breakfast, including cereal, breads & pastries, eggs, cheeses, meats, fresh fruit, tomatoes, olives, jam and honey. We are walkers and walked to the blue Mosque, the Cistern, an array of restaurants and all over the city. There is also a tram one block from the hotel, which we used the day it rained. This same tram took us to the airport. There is free wi-fi, which we used. For us this accommodation was exactly what we were looking for and was an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Consider to come back again”
Reviews.Author: MyJalan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good for budget travel. Located within attraction places and public transport connections. Food need to be improved especially for Asian guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Tina778
Reviews.Content: This is a good budget hotel in a really good location. Grand Bazar and Tram station in walking distance from the hotel. You can walk to Sultanhamet area for sightseeing within 15 mins or 1 tram stop. Staff are freindly and polite, however quite a few cannot speak English. They still try to attempt to communicate with you and try and help but come prepared on what you wish to do and you'll be fine otherwise you may get stuck with getting information on things due to the communication barrier.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Clean, and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: thebeloved
Reviews.Content: It is not in the center of all the Sultanahmet fray but close to the Grand Bazaar and transportation to places like Taksim if you want to explore further. Sultanahmet is in walking distance though. Not all the staff spoke English, but even those who didn't were willing to be helpful and patient. Breakfast is typical Turkish fare of bread, cheese, olives, tomatoes, and the like. The room was larger than most single occupancy rooms I've stayed in and everything was clean and tidy. The internet was spotty at best and went in and out all the time on the 4th floor. But a very pleasant experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend it..”
Reviews.Author: smithm75
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and it was very cheap comparing the other ones with the same standards. The staff is very helpful and polite. Breakfast is delicious. Also the location is very good, close to all major sites. We higly recommend it...

Reviews.Title: “In general excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ellibano
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during my visit to Istanbul; first location was very close to the tramway station from where you can reach all the major attractions. It is also a 15 minutes less or more walking distance from Aya-Sofia and blue mosque. The staff were nice, polite and helpful. The price I paid was half the rate of similar hotels. The internet was fast. The breakfast was very generous, unlike hotels I stayed at in Kiev where the buffet was always empty, on three occasion I ordered coffee and tea which I was never charged for. Rooms were clean, nice and cozy. The only disturbance was the noise from outside which woke me early every day, also TV from next room I hope It was something temporaryâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean and affordable for families or if your staying on your own.”
Reviews.Author: yel_11
Reviews.Content: I styaed ofr a week in the Bilinc Hotel, was very happy with my stay especially because I went by myself, so being close to the main attractions was important. It was in a great location allowing me to access the centre of Istanbul and feel safe at the same time. The room was clean, staff were very helpful and overall was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and convieniently located”
Reviews.Author: eric262
Reviews.Content: I had a really enjoyable stay at the Bilinc Hotel. Not only is it a short walk to the main historic sights of Istanbul but it is also just off the main street so as to avoid all the crowds and traffic. Furthermore, if you wish to explore other areas of Istanbul such as Taksim Square or Dolmabahce Palace then this is easily done by using the tram links which is an even shorter walk away. The room was clean and the breakfast was a great way to start the day. Couldn't have asked for more. Overall, i had a comfortable stay at the hotel and it was well worth it. I'll definitely be returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located family-run budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn H
Reviews.Content: Bilinc is situated on a little street just off the main road near the unversity. It is minutes' walk from the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace, and there are many other sites to see within walking distance. We were particularly impressed with the sultans' tomb and the Basilica Cistern too. The staff appear to be all one family. Not all speak English, but all are friendly and welcoming. Breakfast was excellent, with cereal, breads & pastries, a toaster on hand, eggs, cheese, meats, fresh fruit, jam and honey, and the restaurant is attractively decorated. There was a small leak in our room, but this was not a problem, and the room was kept clean with fresh towels daily.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Positioned Hotel to explore Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ADOL51
Reviews.Content: For Bilinc Hotel one can say; '' I know a nice, clean and friendly hotel close/walking distance to all the main attractions of Istanbul '' This the place to relax after the busy metropol style life tour of Istanbul , specially for the price it is a really CLEAN great little hotel to stay and get ready for the next day after a good and healthy choice of breakfast. I would highly reccomend Bilinc Hotel to all who are sensitive about COMFORT of their place of stay and value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, in a perferct spot”
Reviews.Author: Steve975
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the top location, close to all major attractions. Staff was very helpfull and kind. The room was very clean and had all we needed. Also breakfast was excellent considering how much we paid for the hotel. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst and dirtiest hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: anna_apo
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE! This is the worst and dirtiest hotel I have ever stayed at. At check-in the floor was dirty, dust every where!!! Miserable and mouldy bathroom. Tiny double room, the bed is close to the wall. No way to move in the bathroom... Although we complained about it during our stay (3 nights) no one showed up to clean the room, the housekeeping just changed the towels daily. Poor and cold breakfast, was simply disgusting. Location is about the only good thing â€“ near Grand Bazaar and tram station. This hotel was terrible, please avoid it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Palmc
Reviews.Content: The room was small with one side of the double bed against the wall (the bathroom was nearly as big as the bedroom so it could all have been designed better). There was no drawer space to put away our clothes. There was a fridge which we didn't need to use but I would really have liked tea/coffee making facilities in the bedroom. Breakfast was cereal, cold meats and cheese. The plus side was the situation of the hotel. It was only 2-3 minutes to the Grand Bazaar and another 2-3 minutes to the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofya. Trams were easy to access and were very cheap. I suggest you get a map or know where you want to go before you arrive as the hotel had no information and neither did the tourist office. All we were offered was a map.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great service”
Reviews.Author: mooz110
Reviews.Content: We were there in november 2010 and stayed here for 3 nights. It's a clean hotel with all services,we had a wonderful stay. The rooms are in great condition with hot water 24hrs and a nice breakfast in the morning,i would return back here again.What i liked about this location is it is 3 mins walk to the grand bazaar the covered shopping bazaar.Also the tram stop is 2 mins walk from hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant !”
Reviews.Author: Anna_hh
Reviews.Content: We went to bilinc hotel with a friend of mine and we both love the food, service, our comfy room and ofc the location. It was near to everywhere!! All the staff were nice, kind and helpfull. If I go to turkey again, I will 100% stay there.. Thanks for making our trip much more better!

Reviews.Title: “Don't search too much - choose Hotel "Bilinc"!!!”
Reviews.Author: taalytaaly
Reviews.Content: I spent a New Year time in this hotel and couldn't imagine that "Bilinc" became like home for me. Small, but very cozy and pure. The personnel very kind and attentive. All of them smile and from it have good mood for all day! Breakfasts are European. Always fresh meal, fruit. Once I have wanted to attempt seafood (shrimps, calamari) and on a reception have told me to wait for 5 minutes. For me there has arrived the car and has brought to magnificent fish restaurant "Kalamari" in Kumkapi (not far from hotel), and have then brought back to hotel!! The SUPER! I also didn't assume such service. About hotel always it is possible to drink ANY fresh juice. On foot it is possible to reach any sight (the Blue mosque, the Grand Bazar, etc.) Near to hotel a tram stop. I almost went every day to walk to Bosporus (to go 10 minutes). A transfer ordered in hotel. All quickly and in time. I ADVISE this hotel to everybody! THANK YOU SO MUCH TO STAFF "BILINC"!! From Olga with respect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, very clean”
Reviews.Author: WilliamNc
Reviews.Content: This hotel's room was very clean, bed was comfortable, it is easy to access, close to Bazaar and Metro station, short walk to major attractions in Istanbul, breakfast has good selections, manager and stuff were friendly, highly recommend it to everyone who need the best level of comfort with a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in the very heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Anamariaivanov
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 1 full week in 2002 and a longer weekend in 2004 and both times I thought it was one of the best locations I could possibily find. It is located on the European side of the city, close to the Grand Bazaar (less than a 10 minutes walking)and within a not avery short but certainly a lovely walk from the Spice Bazaar. It is also close to the tram station and it is surrounded by very nice small shops. The people from the reception were of great help with money exchange, giving directions, recommandations regarding best places to buy suvenirs and various other, restaurants, etc. I have made a new booking for this weekend there. PS. I heard the place was newly renovated so I'm even more looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Jim13020
Reviews.Content: Bilinc room was small but clean, breakfast buffet was excellent. The hotel is located a 5 minute walk from the tram stop, or a 15 walk to the Blue Mosque. Our 4-day visit at the Bilinc was pleasant and we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here for the first time in april 2010! by day 2 I really liked it & all staff :)”
Reviews.Author: moosh31
Reviews.Content: I love the staff, the managers' were nice, the manager's son is a great guy :) The lift is a bit noisy at night but other than that I found the team's hospitality amazing...the location is great... I love the buzz & the fact we/I couls walk to my fav landmark...the blue mosque.....I hopw to stay here again in april 2011! :) I have to admit the first time we stayed there in April 2010 (when we first walked in) I was a bit like 'ah oh...' but by the second day i really liked at all because of the lovely team there! also I could watch mtv in the lounge in the evening which was great! :) On the day my dad & I left the staff saw us out which was lovely :) may allah bless them all :) rafia :)

Reviews.Title: “FIne, just fine.”
Reviews.Author: blknw10
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have been to Ist and this time round myself and a few friends had planned to stay in Taksim, but everywhere was crazy busy and stupidly expensive. So we found this place and after reading all the reviews both here and on TA decided to book. The Bilinc is in a great location being in the middle of Laleli-Universite and Beyazit-Kapalicarsi tram stops and a short walk from the Grand Bazaar and all the major sites of Sultanahmet. The hotel could do with refurbishment as though my room was a well sized double I could not get into and use the bathroom as the door when open blocked both the toliet and shower also the main light in the bathroom did not work. The rooms had no warmth or character to them so you wouldn't want to spend more time then you had to in them. My hotel room was clean and the bed was comfortable so no complaints there, we also had free wifi, flat screen TV's and the breakfast though typically turkish, was adequate. Not a place I would particularly recommend to friends but would stay there again if I didn't have time to search for anything else.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FadelOthman
Reviews.Content: Based on the Current room rates: This is probably the coziest, most clean, most peaceful and friendliest hotel I have stayed in during the past three years. General speaking, what I liked most about the hotel are the rooms as they are fully furnished with all what a visitor needs. This is a hotel with great potentials and has a bright future, particularly it is run by the owners who are very understanding, educated, friendly and cooperative. Well done and Goodluck!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with a very good price!”
Reviews.Author: Galyna_S
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel due to the tripadvisor and shall recognize that it is absolutely nice place. They call themselves "home away from home", and it is really true. Polite attentive stuff, clean cozy rooms and just the best location. Let's add to this description good meal on a breakfast and the possibility to get a restful sleep. This place just satisfied me in every point and made me understanding what does the hospitality mean. Highly recommend it to everyone who need the best level of comfort with a reasonable price. Memories from the trip always strictly connected to the place where you stayed, and my experience in this hotel filled my memories with pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable affordable hotel with no luxuries”
Reviews.Author: Amanda24478
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bilinc Hotel for approx 5 nights. It is definately nothing flash but it was acceptable as we were not expecting much due to the price we were paying. Breakfast (cold) was included. Rooms were quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, helpful, friendly staff, clean, and good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: ehore
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights at Bilinc Hotel Istanbul. We were very comfortable, with no complaints, and received good service from staff. We were able to walk to most tourist venues, like the mosques, Grande Bazaar, etc. No hesitation in recommending this hotel to budget conscious travellers.

Reviews.Title: “You will love it!”
Reviews.Author: TONY01_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for the budget-minded. The rooms were clean and the free breakfast was excellent. The hotel staff was helpful and very informative about the city's historical sites.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in best location and moderate prices!”
Reviews.Author: Dorinel_10
Reviews.Content: Nice family owned hotel with very competent and friendly management,always ready to help the customer in any requesting!The location is excelent few minutes by foot from Aya Sophia,Sultan Ahmet Mosque and Grand Bazar!You can save a lot of money coming to the hotel by Metro and tram from Ataturk Airport!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: LondonLovestravel
Reviews.Content: I would say this is an ideal hotel for a city break, we stayed 5 nights and found the location perfect for exploring istanbul. The rooms are basic but very clean (good TV too actually). Breakfast consisted mainly of nice bread unless youre keen on turkish style breakfast (olives, meat, salad). The only problem we encountered was a shower which didnt drain (reported but wasnt fixed - i suspect a language barrier though as the staff were generally friendly- i genuinely think they just didnt understand it was broken and as we were only staying a short time we didnt bother pushing the point). Honestly I would recommend this hotel to friends as a good clean base from which to explore, but perhaps not my slightly picky ones or people who are happy to spend more money.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotel experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: mike39kz
Reviews.Content: I was for 20 times in Istambul but I never met such bad service in such a bad hotel. In the same day you will see 3-4 different persons at reception. They are more than bored and do not want to serve. In case of complains - you have no manager to speak with. The young and un-experienced personel is very impertinent and lasy. Breakfast is very poor. No luggage room. No place to leave the luggage in the lobby ( 6 sq. meters!!!) I stayed 1,5 hour more after 12 o'clock for 10 USD agreed before, but at check out they asked 25 Euro, started to shout, to speak not nice, making me to call the police. They left me to leave when I called the police. I spent hundreds of nights in different hotels around the world. Never met such a bad hotel. Avoid it !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Rocky017
Reviews.Content: We turned up at 8am and were able to check in straight away then check out the next day by noon. The buffet breakfast was 1 of the best we had in Turkey which adds to the value of the stay. Very clean room with TV & a/c, very peaceful & easy walk to Grand Bazaar, Sultanahmet & trams for longer journeys.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION, but be prepared for the basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: Avidtraveler25_9
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Istanbul on a budget. My friend and I paid about $40 a night ($20 each) to stay here. The service was great, the rooms were clean and the free breakfast was an added bonus. The area it is in is AMAZING (walking distance to all the major historical sites) and it's only a few minutes (and about 10 lira) cab ride to get to Taksim square in 'New Europe". The staff was very friendly. This is a basic room though-2 beds and a TV, but it's great if you are sight seeing and just need a place to sleep. It is quiet in the area at night so it was very easy to get a resful night sleep. Safe location :)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but bare bones”
Reviews.Author: Heather025
Reviews.Content: Staff is nice, the rooms are clean but this is truly a simple hotel. Why would you stay here when there are charming small hotels near the more famous monuments for only 15 Euros more? Plus, their airport drop-off service was just a taxi who tried to take me out to lunch before taking me to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid! Booked the hotel, but didnt get the chance to stay”
Reviews.Author: ami_travels
Reviews.Content: Because when I arrived I was informed by the receptionist with a smile on her face that they had to cancel my reservation without announcing me because the manager had some friends coming over or something of this sort, I didnt quite understand because the girl at the reception doesn't speak English very well. Nice way to treat a guest...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cute hotel that's reasonably priced in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Bibsicle123
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the Bilinc hotel it was early morning and I was checked straight in without having to wait! Reception warned me that my room was tiny but they could move me after other guests checked out to a bigger room - I advised this wouldn't be necessary as I was a solo traveler but it was a nice offer regardless. Breakfast was great, a variety of breads, cheeses, spreads, cucumbers, tomatoes, sweets, etc. Coffee was standard American style but when I asked for a Turkish coffee the staff were more than willing to assist. The room itself was clean, bathroom was newly renovated. My window view backed directly across an alley to another building so not a great view but I barely spent any time in the room so I didn't mind. The best thing about the Bilinc is its location. It's right in the middle of town! It's a very reasonably priced hotel for the location and the staff are very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Cancelation”
Reviews.Author: Sidihmed A
Reviews.Content: i have booked in this hotel on saturday, via agency. on tuesday my booking has been canceled fo no reason. when i spoke to the agency they said my credit card was not valid. i have tried making the booking 5 min after i recieved the cancelation and all the rooms has gone..... very very poor service, at least could of contacted me and could of given a different card. i have called my bank and card was fine.....

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: julia687
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Istanbul for 3 nights over Christmas with my brother. The hotel room was fine, not a massive room but fine for the 2 of us. Everything was very clean, beds very comfy & shower was nice and powerful! As with a lot of places in Europe the water temperature did vary depending on what time of day you showered but it was never freezing cold and its just one of those things no major inconvienience. Breakfast is typically turkish with nice fresh bread, cheese, olives, cucumber & tomato which I love! There was free wifi if you take your own laptop or there was a pc you could use in the breakfast room free of charge. Location wise there are lots of clothes shops in the surrounding area and several restaurants, it is a 5-10 min wa lk to the Grand Bazaar and the nearest tram stop. To the central sights of Sultanamhet it is about a 15 min walk and there are lots and lots of restaurants there too. Istanbul was a great place to spend Christmas. We also used the transfer service from Sabiha Gochen airport to the hotel as recommended on the Istanbul forum and it was great for â‚¬10 each. Overall nice hotel, good location, staff were helpful and the main guy on reception speaks brilliant English (and has a striking similarity to Borat!!) thought there was a little language difficulties with some other staff but their english was still much better than my Turkish!! Would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with perfect service close to all Istanbul attractions”
Reviews.Author: Robbal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights during our visit to Istanbul It is nice clean quiet rooms with perfect service and good breakfast in! Walking distance less than 10 minutes to Hagia Sofia...Blue Mosqe... 3 minutes to Grand Bazar... will for sure stay here next time in Istanbul.. Robert/Monica

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, friendly staff, clean and tidy and close to all major attractions, a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: VaxLondon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a wonderful time in Istanbul recently, not often that I write reviews but on this occasion it's more than well deserved. Being a keen traveller i have stayed at many hotels around the world but must say that in terms of how well we were looked after, the convenience to the major attractions and the great value for money this is up there with the best of them. I feel a good hotel adds great value to one's holiday and Bilinc hotel certainly did that, I would definitely recommend it to anyone and already have done so, to close friends and family. We look forward to returning in the not too distant future. Excellent all round, a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “best value for money”
Reviews.Author: liv_dia
Reviews.Content: I've been there at the end of July and was very happy with my choice: great location (walking distance from most attractions in the Sultanahmet aria), great breakfast (nice variety and sufficient food even if you take it 10 minutes before closing time), access to WiFi (but they have their own computer if you don't bring a laptop), air conditioning, very clean and friendly staff. I was very impressed as I arrived at 6am, and they checked us in even if that was before the official check in time (12pm or something). Overall, great choice!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel clean big bathroom good location near beyazit mosque”
Reviews.Author: hamzaistanbul
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel very good for a 3 star small fridge and plasma tv in room 2 minute walk from beyazit mosque near grand bazaar close to blue mosque etc there was constuction going on outside but not at night.

HotelInfo.Name: Bilinc Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Ordu Caddesi, Sekbanbasi Sok. No 4, Istanbul 34490, Turkey
